intro: Silene velutinoides subsp. mellifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a velvety texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Silene velutinoides subsp. mellifera is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
